title: FLOOR AREA COVERED WITH GREASE AND GRIME
content:
Section 3.1: FLOOR AREA COVERED WITH GREASE AND GRIME

OBSERVATION:
Many floors and machinery within the Mill were observed to be covered with grease and 
grime. This condition not only compromises the cleanliness and overall housekeeping 
standards but also poses significant safety and operational risks. it may pose  risks as 
follows:  
 
Slips, Trips, and Falls:  
 - Greasy floors increase the likelihood of accidents, leading to potential injuries to 
personnel.  
 
Operational Inefficiencies:  
 - Greasy machinery may experience reduced efficiency and increased wear and tear, 
potentially leading to mechanical failures and unplanned downtime.  
 
Fire Hazards:  
 - The accumulation of grease and oil can act as a fuel source, increasing the risk of fire, 
especially in areas where machinery operates at high temperatures.

RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the followings:  
 
Thorough Cleaning:  
 - Implement a regular and comprehensive cleaning schedule to remove grease from 
floors and machinery. Use appropriate cleaning agents and tools suitable for the Millâ€™s 
operations to ensure effective grease removal.  
 
Preventive Maintenance:  
 - Establish a preventive maintenance program to regularly inspect and clean machinery. 
Ensure that oil leaks or spills from machinery are promptly identified and rectified.  
 
Housekeeping Standards:  
 - Train staff on the importance of maintaining high housekeeping standards. Introduce 
workplace cleanliness policies, ensuring that all employees contribute to maintaining a 
clean and safe working environment.  
 
Non-Slip Flooring:  
 - Consider installing non -slip flooring or mats in high -risk areas to minimize the risk of 
slips and falls.

REGULATION/GUIDELINE:
1. Occupational Safety and Health Act 1994 (Act 514)  
 
General Duties of Employers and Self -Employed Persons to Their Employees  (Section 
15) 
- This section mandates that employers and self -employed individuals ensure, as far as 
practicable, the safety, health, and welfare of their employees at work. This includes 
providing and maintaining a work environment that is safe and without health risks, 
which implicitly covers good housekeeping practices  
 
Duty to Formulate Safety and Health Policy  (Section 16)  
 
Employers are required to prepare and revise a written statement of their general policy concerning the safety and health at work of their employees.  
 
Note: This policy should include arrangements for maintaining a safe working 
environment, which would involve proper housekeeping measures
